Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm looking forward to 'Take Your Daughter to Work' day. I am not great with kids, but I wanna get better. Because I'm getting married. So, I put out a bunch of extra candy out on my desk so the kids will come talk to me. ...Like the witch in Hanzel and Gretel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bribery. Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I have more. [Holds up bags of candy]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam. Ms. Beasley if yer nastay! Janet Jackson. Hey! You having a wardrobe malfunction there? Or w--

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael. You can't be nasty today. [whispering] 'Cause of the... [points to 'Welcome Daughters!' sign]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... Oh, God is that today?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I reminded you last night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen, I like kids. But this is not a kid's environment. This is like HBO, no limits. Who knows what I'm going to say? Crazy stuff. And it is R rated, it is not rated G. I am like Eddie Murphy in "Raw," and they are trying to make me into Eddie Murphy in "Daddy Daycare." both great movies, but, still.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'll be in my office.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't you think you should say something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, I think that as the boss you should really--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine. Hi, children. I'm Michael Scott, and... I... am in charge of this place... ahh, what'll make you... understand... I am... like Superman, and the people who work here are like citizens of Gotham City.

Quote.Speaker: Jim and Dwight
Quote.Text: [in unison] That's Batman.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm Aquaman. Where does he live, guys?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The ocean.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [under his breath] I work with a bunch of nerds.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looks at Sasha] Mmm... hello tiny one.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [to Sasha] Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are the future!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This... is my file cabinet. Uhm... oh. This... is the partition... between my desk... and Angela's.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Abby's my fiancee Stacy's daughter, I think she'll have a good time. I just hope she doesn't look on my computer. ...Actually, I'd better go check.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael, you remember my daughter, Melissa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yes, hello, how are you? Good to see you. Wow, you've really grown up. You know what? Don't mind me saying so, she is turning into a stone cold fox. Better keep the... frat boys away from her.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: I'm in eighth grade.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: She's in middle school.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, middle school's amazing. It is extraordinary. An extraordinary time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not that children make me uncomfortable, it's just that, why be a dad when you can be a fun uncle? I've never heard of anyone rebelling against their fun uncle.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [while Jake is throwing things at Michael] They want how many spiral pads?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Um, fif-well, fifty... I... over ordered because they had a back order.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I got permission to bring Jake into work, which is great because he got suspended this week and now I don't have to pay for a sitter.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can you put that down there?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yep. [spreads tablecloth]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [to Sasha] Okay, tell them what you wanted to say.

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: Do you need any help?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. Thanks. We'd... have to explain everything, it's probably just easier if we do it ourselves.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Alright, I wasn't expecting that. Let's uh... let's go draw.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, she is so cute, I want to die. Don't you just love kids, Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I guess I wouldn't mind a pair of small, well-behaved boys.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: God I cannot wait to get pregnant and have babies!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly and I both agreed that we would just have fun, and, I'm learning that fun for Kelly is... getting married and having babies. Immediately. With me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Just compare last year's order to this year's. Uh-huh. Yeah, I'm looking at it right now. [Sasha walks in the door] ... Yes. We-yeah, they're very-they're different. [Sasha walks out] Yeah, we can stick with last year's, you're just going to have to supplement it, somehow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Abby! Do you want to help me shred some old documents? It's actually pretty cool.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: No thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I only have one goal today. To make one kid like me. Just one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you reading?

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aww, best book?

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I've read it before.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pfft. So have I. Hey, question. If you had to spend a night in the Met or the Aquarium, which would it be?

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Definitely the Aquarium.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Definitely. Yes. Glad you said that. ...You don't want to help me with some of my sales, do you? 'Cause, I'm kind of swamped.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Mmhmm!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yesss. And you're Abby, right?

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm Jim. [Jim hi-fives Abby] Annnnd... let's sell some paper.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's start with... your mom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yes. Well... we can... [Sasha walks in, begins playing with Michael's toy train] uhm... hey, uh, you know what? Can I call you back? I'll call you right back. Yes, I promise. ...Hello, can I help you? ... You can pick that up, if you want. That's-- that's alright. [Sasha moves the train to Michael's desk] Want to bring it over... here, make some room. My name's Michael. What's your name?

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: Sasha.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: Ooh! [picks up train whistle]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you know what that is! That is a train whistle, like I'm the conductor. [blows into whistle] But I'm sort of the conductor of the office here, right? [blows into whistle] You want to try?

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: Sure. [Sasha blows into whistle continously]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All aboard for sales! Next stop, Cu...camonga! [Sasha and Michael laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [shaking hands with Abby] Ow, ow, ow, ow, you broke my hand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is no way that hurt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? 'Cause she's pretty strong, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Little girl. Come over here. Shake my hand. Come on, I don't have all day. [Abby shakes his hand] I don't feel anything. Nothing. [to Jim] You're so weak. [Jake walks over and messes with Dwight's bobbleheads] Uh, excuse me, these are expensive collector's items, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Do you have any computer games?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I don't have computer games on my work computer. That would be innappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Yeah, Meredith doesn't have any either. It's so lame here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You call your mom Meredith? That's very disrespectful.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Whatever, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can refer to me as Mister Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: That's your name? Mister Poop?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Schrute. Mister Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Sure, Mister Poop. [Jake walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [quietly] ... Schrute. [Jim and Abby snicker, Angela glares at Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: [to Phyllis] Are you Mother Goose?

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: I drink like, a hundred Ice Macchiatos a day, and practically nothing else.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: There's a really cool coffee place, Jitters, at the Steamtown Mall. Ever been there?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: You've never been to Jitters? Ryan, you are so dorky. Gimme your number, so I can text you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uhm...

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Come on! [Kelly glares through the door] You have an email address?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: ...that I thought you should know ...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mmhmm. What?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I think something a little fishy is going on. [points to Ryan and Melissa]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: A little fishy?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah. I mean, I've been noticing them all day, I was thinking that maybe ... [Stanley gets up]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That little girl is a child! I don't want to see you sniffing around her anymore this afternoon, do you understand?!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, I-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Boy have you lost your mind? 'Cause I'll help you find it! Whatcha lookin' for, ain't nobody gonna help you out there! Jesus could come through that door and he's not gonna help you if you don't stop sniffing after my child!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Stanley yelled at me today. That was one of the most frightening experiences of my life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [plays the recorder] That was Greensleeves. A traditional English Ballad about the beheaded Anne Boleyn. And now, a very special treat... a book my Grandmutter used to read me when I was a kid. This is a very special story, it's called Struwwelpeter, by Heinrich Hoffman from 1864. [reading from book] The great tall tailor always comes to little girls that suck their thumbs-- are you listening, Sasha? Right? And 'ere they dream when he's about, he takes his great sharp scissors out, and then cuts their thumbs clean off!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight! Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's a photo...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell are you reading to them?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: These are cautionary tales for kids, my Grandmata used to read these--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, you know what? No, no no no no. They, no. The kids don't want to hear some wierdo book that your Nazi war criminal grandmother gave you.

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: What's a Nazi?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's a Nazi?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [standing up] Nazi was a fascist movement...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...from the 1930's...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't! Don't! Don't talk about Nazis in front of-- you know what? They're going to have nightmares, so why don't you just shut it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was gonna teach the children how to make corn-husk dolls.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighing] Why don't you just leave? Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Bye, Mister Poop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. There goes Mister Poop. Now, who likes Dane Cook?

Quote.Speaker: The Kids
Quote.Text: [raising hands] I do, I do!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Children cannot lie. They are innocent, and they speak the truth, and out of the mouths of babes, Michael Scott is freaking cool. [cracks up]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You know, I never misbehaved in front of my father because he was a very strict disciplinarian. I can only hope my mate has some of those same qualities [makes eye contact with Dwight].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is where the magic happens! Right over here, let me show you this. See all these? [pets shelf of paper] You know what that is? That's paper. This is where paper comes from. Any questions?

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: So... you cut the paper and dye it and stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we don't actually cut the paper. That's a good question. The paper is sent to us cut, and dyed, from a paper manufacturer, and then we sell it to a business for more than we paid for it.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: That's not fair. [the rest of the kids agree]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is, well, w-w-you need someone in the middle to facilitate...

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: You're just a middleman.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not just a middle... man...

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Wait, why doesn't the saw mill just sell paper directly to people?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are describing Office Depot, and they're kind of running us out of business.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have better service than they do!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...There's Creed! Let's take a look at what he's doing, everybody! This is Creed, and he is in charge of... something. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That is correct.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Say hi to the kids.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hi kids.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yaaaaay.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Have you ever seen a foot with four toes? [begins untying shoe]

Quote.Speaker: Kids
Quote.Text: Ewwww!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing? N-stop it! Stop it! Just-no, no, no, no! No! Would you cut it out?! What is your problem?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Th-the hair covers it, mostly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no, we're not gonna see-- we're not gonna see the four toed... Creed, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, there's something interesting about me you might want to know. I ... used to be ... the star of a kids show.

Quote.Speaker: Kids
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's true. I did.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: You serious?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am totally serious. There was a show called 'Fundle Bundle' and I was the star.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: That doesn't sound like a show.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's true! I can prove it! I can prove it, watch this. [gets up and runs out] Ryan, can you come here a second? [clears throat] I would like you to go to my mother's house in Dickson city, and if she is in the pool, the back kitchen window should be unlocked, I want you to boost yourself up, I want you to go down to the basement. In the basement is a tape labeled 'Fundle Bundle'. I want you to grab it, I want you to get my guitar.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Right. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to get the tambourine. Do you know how to play the tambourine?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um, I'm already getting the pizzas from Bernetti's, so...

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: You know, I can go with him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oka-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No! I will... go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! Thank you Ryan. Good attitude, hottest in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Abby] Alright, nowwww... what kind... of pizza do you like?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't get why parents are always complaining about how tough it is to raise kids. You joke around with them, you give them pizza, you give them candy, you let them live their lives... They're adults, for God's sake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to give you a little blast from the past of Michael Gary Scott when he was a child star, and a show that you might remember called 'Fundle Bundle.' Okay? Without further ado, Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Miss Trudy
Quote.Text: [from TV] ...Bundle, are you ready to come on in? [TV children cheer] Let's have some fun!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That... is Miss Trudy. Can't tell from the costume, but she had an amazing body. Okay, you can... fast forward. And... I want you... to...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that a real fun shooting windmill?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop! Stop! Stop! [Ryan resumes the tape] Yes! That is, uh, Edward R. Meow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's pretty funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Edward R. Meow
Quote.Text: ...Recess! Hey, what's your name?

Quote.Speaker: Chet
Quote.Text: My name's Chet.

Quote.Speaker: Edward R. Meow
Quote.Text: Well hi Chet.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is that Chet Montgomery?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uhh, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That is!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Checkin' in with Chet. Doppler's up.

Quote.Speaker: Edward R. Meow
Quote.Text: What do you want to be when you grow up?

Quote.Speaker: Chet
Quote.Text: I want to be on TV!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [employees chuckle] And he is on TV now!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can everyone please shut up, please! So you don't miss it.

Quote.Speaker: Edward R. Meow
Quote.Text: Okay, next? So, whats your name?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! That's me. Shh. Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Edward R. Meow
Quote.Text: Well what's your favorite subject at school?

Quote.Speaker: Young Michael
Quote.Text: Recess.

Quote.Speaker: Edward R. Meow
Quote.Text: Ree-cesss. So tell me, what do you want to be when you grow up?

Quote.Speaker: Young Michael
Quote.Text: I want to be married and have a hundred kids so I can have a hundred friends, and no one can say no to being my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Edward R. Meow
Quote.Text: [jaw drops, awkward pause] Uh, ah... oh, okay! Well uh, nice talking with you, Michael. Uh, back to you Miss Trudy!

Quote.Speaker: Miss Trudy
Quote.Text: Hi everyone, it's one of my favorite times of the day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Coulda sworn there was...

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Did you get married?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...uh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, just never happened.

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: So, do you have any kids?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, nope.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Do you have a girlfriend?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do okay.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Was Chet Montgomery cool back then?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Even I have a girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! Alright, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: So you didn't get to be what you wanted to be.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...I guess not... you know, I have a load of work to do so I am going to grab a slice of this delish pizza... and I'm going to go do my work. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's not coming out. He won't pick up the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can't believe his mom dressed him like that, that's the real tragedy.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [wrestling with Jake] Pam! Pam! I love this guy! [laughs] Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, Melissa... I met your mom a couple times. She's so nice.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Who? Terry?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: That woman is not my mother. That is my step-mother.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Mister Poop, I have to tell you something.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, okay. But first, that's not my name.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: You're ugly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well at least I'm not a horrible little latchkey kid who got suspended from school. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Meredith!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Toby knocks on door] Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I think these belong to you. [puts toys down on desk]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that's okay, she can keep those.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Believe me, she has enough toys... she doesn't need your watch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Is everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have to ask me that because you work for human resources.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh... it's true...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, sure, playing the field is great, don't get me wrong, but there's more to life than notches just on my bedpost.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell me something honestly, do you... think... that it is too late for me to have kids?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, you need a wife first, or at least a girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Not Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Jan. Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: If you really want to have kids, I-- I guess you could somehow... foster parent, or something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Or biologically.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Somehow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks, that's, no, that... that really means a lot to me. Hey, does Sasha have a godfather, because I...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... kay.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Is it okay if I take one?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Is your job hard?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's not too bad. I get to shred things sometimes, do you want to see?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Um... here it is. Don't put your fingers in there. [shreds paper] Cool huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: That's so cool, yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I get to do this like, every week.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: That's so awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, it is true. I, Michael Scott, am signing up with an online dating service. Thousands of people have done it, and I am going to do it. I need a username. And... I have a great one [types]. Little kid lover. That way, people will know exactly where my priorities are at.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Do you want to come over for dinner tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ohh, man, I would love to! I can't tonight, but can I come over some other time? [Abby nods]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What're you doing? You never have plans.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks, Kev. Uhm... I'm actually going on a date.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Niiice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, no, please? You can't leave yet. There's still one more thing we need to do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] You... who are on the road... must have a code... that you can live by... [Dwight joins in] and so... become yourself... because the past... is just a goodbye... and teach... your children well...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why does he own a guitar if he doesn't know how to play?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think he thought his ukulele skills would transfer. [Jim leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] ...did slowly go by... and feed... them on your dreams...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My theory is that... [Jim signals he's leaving, waves bye to Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] ...The one they picked... the one you'll know by... don't you ever ask them why... if I told you would cry... you never look at them and sigh... and know they love you...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And they do, your parents, love you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One more time. [singing] You...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Schrutes consider children very valuable. In the olden days, the women would bear many children, so we would have enough laborers to work the fields. And if it was an especially cold winter, and there weren't enough grains or vegetables, they would eat the weakest of the brood. [Laughs] They didn't eat the children.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay. I think five plain and one veggie should be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: How about pepperoni?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I like extra cheese.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Absolutely not.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like extra cheese, too.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fine. The first lesson we'll teach children will be about obesity.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm pretty excited about today. I baby-sit Toby's daughter Sasha sometimes. So, she's the coolest kid. She has seen me play with dolls, though, so I don't know how cool she thinks I am.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Put that away and learn.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Learn what?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Learn why Daddy's so cranky when he comes home from work.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I brought my daughter Melissa in. That girl is very spoiled. That child has no idea what I have to deal with so she can have her little cell phone and spend all my money at that Steamtown Mall.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go read my book now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [whispering] Angela. Is it okay if I'm the head accountant today?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm the head accountant.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, but can I say that I'm it, just for today?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I can't set that kind of precedent. She's a bright girl. She'd see right through that.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You must be pretty strong, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You think you can beat up Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Yeah. I don't know, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I think you might be able to.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You think you could beat me up?

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Then you gotta have muscles, man. You got some muscles? Let's see.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: I got some muscles. You wanna see the muscles? Bam! Look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, don't touch him, please!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Man, you have got to be kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Didn't do background checks of the warehouse guys. [exclaims] Well, I'm sure it'll be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Can I have a quarter? I promise I'll pay you back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Can I have a dollar? Then I can buy chips and a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Jake
Quote.Text: Will you marry my mom?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Melissa. Hey. I was working. I was in the middle of something.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Just give me two seconds, I'll be done.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I was in the middle of something.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Dude, seriously, just give me two seconds, I'll be done.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: ...get you, I'm gonna get you! Come back here for more! [squealing]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Kids, kids, kids, slow down.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm gonna get you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What the... [pulls a pencil eraser out of his mug, after a drink]

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Did you draw that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Do you like to draw, Abby?

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I wanna be an artist when I grow up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Me, too.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: You are grown up.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So, how's your day been?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. It's been a little more tiring than I thought.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, it doesn't help that Stanley's daughter's such a slut.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Abby. I wanted to give you this for all your hard work today. Look. Michael signed it and everything. Official.

Quote.Speaker: Abby
Quote.Text: Thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I hate to break it to you, Abby. The certificate's a fake. Okay? It's not real. Where's the certification number, Halpert?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually, I have the certification number right here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, really? Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. Okay. Fine. Well done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "A7557962." Totally nonsense numbers, but you do what you have to do.
